qas.question: Who was sued for patent infringement on MP3 technology?
Who initially sued to protect their patent rights?
What did Sisvel grant Thomson to end the lawsuit?
When did the majority of the patents held by Sisvel expire?
When does the last patent held by Sisvel expire?

context: <a1_0>Sisvel S.p.A.<a1_0/> and its U.S. subsidiary Audio MPEG, Inc. previously sued <a0_0>Thomson<a0_0/> for patent infringement on MP3 technology, but those disputes were resolved in November 2005 with Sisvel granting Thomson <a2_0>a license to their patents<a2_0/>. Motorola followed soon after, and signed with Sisvel to license MP3-related patents in December 2005. Except for three patents, the US patents administered by Sisvel had all expired in <a3_0>2015<a3_0/>, however (the exceptions are: U.S. Patent 5,878,080, expires February 2017, U.S. Patent 5,850,456, expires February 2017 and U.S. Patent 5,960,037, expires <a4_0>9. April 2017<a4_0/>.
